body:
Oh and it's not really like `#first_or_create` because it will issue an update to the first one it finds.

The difference is the following:

```ruby
@user.memberships.first_or_create(role: 'admin')
```

That code will just look up the first membership for the user, but won't update the user to being an admin.

And It's more like a `PATCH` request in that it's based on a relation that will update or create a record based on all of the attributes given (and the relation) than it is a `PUT` that requires all attributes. But of course both of those methods usually require an existing record. I see what you're getting at and I think the PATCH vs PUT argument is only relevant when arguing about HTTP caching so I'll digress.

Thanks again for your input
